radiographic_examinations.findings: bilateral multifocal patchy opacities, a finding suggestive of pneumonia
radiographic_examinations.changes_over_time: On a subsequent chest radiograph obtained one day before continuous venovenous hemofiltration was initiated, there was evidence of an increase in bilateral consolidation and interstitial opacities, suggestive of worsening pulmonary edema, pneumonia, or acute respiratory distress syndrome.
